Comb. loge O ioge ) ioge E Å 8 I c l @ Time = 300 Clock 100ps — 20ps 100ps 20ps 100ps 20ps Conp b g () D D Glock @ Time = 359 100ps — 20ps 100ps 20ps 100ps 20ps Gomb. logie A Glock Figure 435 One clock cycle of pipeline operation. Just before the clock rises at time 240 (point 1), instructions 11 (shown in dark gray) and I2 (shown in blue) have completed stages B and A. After the clock rises, these instructions begin propagating through stages C and B, while instruction T3 (shown in light gray) begins propagating through stage A (points 2 and 3). Just before the clock rises again, the results for the instructions have propagated to the inputs of the pipeline registers (point 4).
